about.title: About Me
about.description: My name is Lembrez Shun, a second-year student in Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science at IUT de Lens. I am passionate about new technologies, which I have been able to discover and learn through my studies and personal projects. I am curious and motivated, always seeking new challenges to deepen my knowledge in the field of computer science.
about.titleF1: Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science
about.institutionF1: University Institute of Technology (IUT) of Lens
about.descriptionF1: Training focused on software development, including programming in Java, Python, and PHP, database management with SQLite and PostgreSQL, as well as web application design. Participation in collaborative projects and learning of agile methodologies.
about.descriptionF2: High honors – Specializations: Mathematics, Computer Science and Digital Sciences (NSI) Option: Advanced Mathematics
about.specialitiesF2: Mathematics, Computer Science and Digital Sciences (NSI)
about.companyE1: University Institute of Technology (IUT) of Lens
about.descriptionE1: Weekly tutoring sessions for first-year students: assisting with course understanding, providing personalized support, and monitoring academic progress. Developed strong skills in pedagogy, communication, and organization.
about.descriptionE2: Full immersion in a corporate IT department: user support, system maintenance, and introduction to software development.
about.Tirer2E2: Exposure to professional programming languages: PHP, LANSA, RPG
about.Tirer3E2: Infrastructure: Windows servers, IBM AS/400, networking & IP telephony
about.passionIntro: Since my childhood, I have always been drawn to computers, video games, and the desire to always know "How does this work?"
about.passionLycee: At first, it was mainly mathematics that interested me, long before I discovered the Digital and Computer Science (NSI) specialization, which precisely combines math and computer science. In middle school, there wasn’t really an equivalent subject: the closest was visual arts, where I often stood out thanks to original projects. I loved experimenting and innovating, whether with 3D printing, laser engraving, or creating websites. This curiosity naturally led me to choose the NSI specialization in high school, which I immediately enjoyed. There, I discovered programming and wrote my first lines of code, notably in Python and HTML/CSS.
about.passionBUT: My first year of the undergraduate program confirmed my interest in computer science, and more specifically in development. I was able to acquire a solid foundation and learned to work in a team on my first "real" projects.
about.sportDesc1: I also enjoy practicing sports, especially rock climbing, which gives me a real sense of freedom, as well as swimming occasionally to stay fit.
about.sportDesc2: I also practice target shooting from time to time — a passion I probably developed thanks to video games. I enjoy anything that requires precision and control, qualities I find in this discipline.
about.pianoDesc: I recently started playing the piano, in September 2024, and I am learning as a self-taught musician. I enjoy discovering new things and progressing on my own, which makes this activity particularly stimulating.
about.gamingDesc1: I also play video games that combine competition, strategy, and cooperation, such as Overwatch, where I reached the Top 150 European ranking in 2020.
about.gamingDesc2: I also enjoy narrative-driven games, such as Expedition 33, an exceptional French game with incredible music and atmosphere.
about.beyondCodeConclusion: These passions nurture my curiosity, creativity, and logical thinking — qualities that are essential in software development.
